company_context: Streamlit ‚Ä¢ A faster way to build and share data apps üéà What's new: Try Cortex Code CLI for AI-powered Streamlit development ‚ùÑÔ∏è A faster way to build and share data apps Turn your data scripts into shareable web apps in minutes. All in pure Python. No front‚Äëend experience required. Get started Try the live playground! Play Learn more with the Streamlit crash course on YouTube Trusted by over 90% of Fortune 50 companies As of 2024-11-15 Get started in under a minute Streamlit is an open-source app framework that is a breeze to get started with. Just install it like any other Python library: pip install streamlit ‚Üê Copy to clipboard Copied! streamlit hello ‚Üê Copy to clipboard Copied! And that's it! Next, check out our documentation and forums for more. Or you can skip local installation altogether: ‚Üí Try a live playground in your browser The easiest way to try Streamlit before you install. ‚Üí Build in public with Streamlit Community Cloud Public apps only. Totally free. You just need a GitHub account. ‚Üí Build like a pro on Snowflake Unlimited private apps. Enterprise-grade reliability and security. Streamlit builds upon three simple principles Embrace scripting Build an app in a few lines of code with our magically simple API . Then see it automatically update as you iteratively save the source file. MyApp.py import streamlit as st import pandas as pd st. write ( """ # My first app Hello *world!* """ ) df = pd. read_csv ( "my_data.csv" ) st. line_chart ( df ) My App ‚Ä¢ Streamlit My first app Hello world! Weave in interaction Adding a widget is the same as declaring a variable . No need to write a backend, define routes, handle HTTP requests, connect a frontend, write HTML, CSS, JavaScript, ... Deploy instantly The choice is yours ‚Äî show off your public apps for free on Streamlit Community Cloud , go with Snowflake for enterprise‚Äëgrade deployment, or pick something else entirely! conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Hi, my name is Alex and I'm reaching out from DeepData AI. We're a data processing solution that can help you streamline your data workflows and gain more insights. I came across your company and saw that you're using Streamlit for building data apps. I think our solution could be a great fit to enhance your data capabilities.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: Ah, yes. We do use Streamlit. But I'm not sure what you mean by "enhance our data capabilities". We're pretty happy with what we have right now. What makes you think we need something more?

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Well, from what I understand, Streamlit is great for building and sharing data apps, but it might not be optimized for large-scale data processing. Our solution can help you handle bigger datasets, reduce processing time, and provide more advanced analytics. We've had success with similar companies in the past, and I think we could bring significant value to your organization.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: I see what you're saying, but we're actually in the middle of a contract with a competitor, DataForge. We've invested a lot in their platform, and I'm not sure it would be feasible to switch to a new solution right now. Plus, I'm not sure if our team would be able to integrate your solution with our existing infrastructure.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I completely understand the concern about being locked into a contract. However, I'd like to discuss how our solution could potentially save you money in the long run and provide more flexibility. As for integration, we have a dedicated team that can help with onboarding and ensure a seamless transition. We've also had success with integrating with Streamlit in the past, so I think we could make it work.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: I appreciate the offer, but I'm still not convinced. Even if we were to consider switching, I think the timing would be off. We're in the middle of a critical project, and I don't want to introduce any new variables that could disrupt our workflow. And to be honest, the cost of your solution is a bit higher than what we're currently paying. I'm not sure if our budget can accommodate the increase.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I understand your concerns, and I appreciate your honesty. I'd like to propose a pilot project to demonstrate the value of our solution and show you how it can fit into your existing workflow. We could also discuss pricing and see if there's any flexibility we can offer.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: I appreciate the proposal, but I think we're going to have to pass. We're committed to seeing our contract with DataForge through, and I don't think it would be responsible to explore other options at this time. Thank you for reaching out, but I think we'll have to decline your offer.

analysis.raw:
Score: 4
Outcome: Failure
Key_Objection: Competitors
Feedback: The seller should have more aggressively addressed the buyer's existing contract with a competitor and explored potential exit strategies or incentives for switching to their solution. Sentiment: Neutral

parsed.feedback: The seller should have more aggressively addressed the buyer's existing contract with a competitor and explored potential exit strategies or incentives for switching to their solution. Sentiment: Neutral
